attributes.action:
Johnson & Sunak must resign.
Boris lied in parliament.
Both broke own laws.
attributes.additional_details:
Boris Johnson, Prime Minister of the UK, and Rishi Sunak, the Chancellor, were today issued fines for breaking lockdown regulations. Boris Johnson is believed to be the first Prime Minister to have broken the law whilst in office, a law set under his premiership.

He has persistently lied in the house and therefore broken the ministerial code he should be removed from office if he does not resign not least to uphold the integrity of the house.

Both are no longer fit for the positions they hold
attributes.background:
Remove Johnson and Sunak from office if they do not resign.

They have broken their own laws and the PM has consistently lied to the house and by the ministerial code should resign.

They should also apologise to the nation of people who abided the law and the millions who suffered as a result

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for MPs or Ministers to be sacked or for them to resign.
